articles.title: Bangladesh’s Yunus could quit over lack of reform progress, student leader says
articles.description: Nahid Islam, the head of the newly-formed National Citizen Party (NCP), which wants national elections held only after the completion of reforms, said Yunus was finding it difficult to work without the backing of political parties.
articles.content:
Bangladesh’s de-facto prime minister has threatened to step down if political parties cannot agree on reforms that citizens await with growing impatience, a top student leader has said, deepening uncertainty in the wake of deadly protests last year.

articles.title: How a Brazilian content creator was stabbed over 10 times on a livestream days & survived
articles.description: A 22-year-old Brazilian influencer, Luna Ambrozevicius Abrahao, was reportedly stabbed during a 'live' broadcast by her boyfriend. The content creator could be seen dripping blood and screaming as her followers reached out to emergency services.
